instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> very lite water damage at O/I and very lite at <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>...i was replace O/I and reball <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>.
no green light no fan <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.2v
p3v42 - 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short."
Exact ohm value?

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> level?

threads.message:
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>-0.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V

What this mean?
I asked about ohm value, you said to have short there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message: Dido mode 23ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
Not a pure short, but really bad value.
Possibly nothing heats if try voltage injection.
Lift one side L7560 and see where the low value remains.

Check for bad values on the other big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message: sorry the value on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 004ohm(full short) i was lift l7560 but the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message: Low enough to use voltage injection method...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
o.k fint the short now i have 3.3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> but i have 0.02v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_L</SIGNAL>
REPLACE l7560 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is not the same with <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> from L7560.

Which is the ohm value, or diode mode to ground at L7560???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message: 330ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
So you have 3.3V at L7560, or 0.02V?
Specify when you post voltage, or diode mode.
Or directly omit the "V" when you post diode mode!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
on L7560 WITH CHARGER 0.2V BOTH SIDE!!
AT DIODE MODE 350ohm!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message: diode mode of course without charger!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
Don't write ohm, if you measured in diode mode (nor volt also).
Just write .350 and will understand is diode mode; ohm value will be slightly different.

Post <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> volatges; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
"12 -0v"
Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>?
If yes, reball SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message: great it was water under SMC now works thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT NO FAN-<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> SHORT
threads.message:
the board is back.....dead, green and orange light, NO fan spin NO bypass SMC.
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> 1.1V, 0 then 1.1v when trigger  <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> .
